From when America's armed forces entered World
War I in 1917 until today, the United States

6.text:
military has repeatedly made the difference
between Civilization and Barbarism.

12.text:
It's no exaggeration to say that a militarily strong
America is the one indispensable prerequisite

19.text:
for a peaceful and prosperous world. The witness
of history, as well as our own common sense,

26.text:
bear testament to the fact that when America's
armed forces are powerful, focused and feared,

32.text:
the globe is a better place than when she
is weak, unprepared and vacillating.

38.text: In the past century alone there have been four great threats made to peace, democracy and freedom.

45.text:
Each of them have come from enemies
that hate and fear what the United States stands for,

50.text:
as laid down in her Declaration
of Independence, Constitution and Bill of Rights.

55.text:
Three of these have come from differing
mutations of Fascism, and one from its totalitarian twin,

61.text:
Communism. In each case it has been
the US military that has been a principal

66.text:
force protecting the Free World from the tyranny
these threats have sought to impose.

73.text:
The First World War sprung from Germany's
bid for hegemony over Europe and was powered

78.text:
by a Prussian military machine that was proto-Fascist
in its outlooks, ambitions and assumptions.

85.text:
When the discovery of the infamous Zimmerman
Telegram revealed that Germany wanted to extend

90.text:
the War even into the American heartland,
the Wilson Administration sent hundreds of

95.text:
thousands of young American recruits -- nicknamed
'doughboys' -- onto the battlefields of Europe,

101.text: and tipped the balance in the Allies' favor.

104.text:
25 years later, the American armed forces
were again fighting against the second mutation

110.text:
of Fascist ideology -- as espoused by Nazi
Germany and Imperial Japan.

116.text:
On battlefields as distant from America as tiny islands in
the south Pacific, picturesque villages in

123.text:
Italy and desolate towns in Northern Africa
as well as on the sea in the Atlantic and

128.text:
in the skies over Germany, the American armed
forces made another invaluable contribution to victory.

134.text:
Yet the fight for freedom wasn't over. Almost
as soon as WWII ended a new threat arose,

141.text:
the Red Fascist version of totalitarianism
-- Soviet Communism. It soon cast its shadow

147.text:
over Eastern Europe as well as parts of Africa,
Asia and Latin America. American military might,

154.text:
deployed intelligently and globally,
played the key role in neutralizing and then

159.text:
ultimately bankrupting that terrible menace
to the Free World. When victory in the Cold

166.text:
War in the late 1980s and early 1990s finally
came under the presidencies of Ronald Reagan

172.text:
and George H. W. Bush, it was because
the US armed forces were kept strong enough

177.text:
to deal with the ceaseless probing and provocations
of the Soviet Union over nearly half a century.

185.text:
Since 9/11 the world has been faced with yet
another mutation of Fascism, fundamentalist

191.text:
Islamist terrorism. Taking on many of the
features of earlier Fascist movements --

197.text:
hatred of democracy and Christianity, a fanatical
anti-Americanism and anti-Semitism,

203.text:
and a desire for utter uniformity -- the Islamist
terror movement has caused death and destruction

210.text:
wherever it has appeared. The Fascist bacillus
has mutated yet again, but it is alive and well.

217.text:
And yet again, the traditional antidote, the
American military, has taken up the task.

223.text:
By taking on the forces of Terror in full-scale
wars in Afghanistan and Iraq, the US made

230.text:
it clear that it would not permit Fascism
to triumph in our time, any more than earlier

235.text:
generations of Americans permitted it to in
theirs.

239.text:
All this has come at great cost -- in lives
and money. The cost of these precious lives,

245.text:
men and women, fighting for others freedom
far from their homes, can never be repaid.

252.text:
But the money -- a defense budget that is by
far the largest in the world -- has been well spent.

257.text:
It has protected the honor, power and
prestige of the USA, upon which the cause

266.text:
When the US armed forces are weak -- as they
were before the Second World War, when America

270.text:
had only the 14th largest army in the world
-- the likes of Adolf Hitler are encouraged

276.text:
to make larger and larger demands. When US
armed forces are strong, however, even a superpower

283.text:
like the Soviet Union has to acknowledge its
own internal contradictions and inability

289.text:
to overawe the West. With China rearming massively
and posing a growing threat to Western interests

295.text:
and values around the world, and the threat
of Islamist fascism still upon us, it is well

300.text:
to learn the central lesson of the past half-century
of human experience, which is that for her

305.text:
own sake and that of those who love freedom
everywhere, the United States must be militarily

313.text:
I'm Andrew Roberts for 
Prager University.
